meanings.definition: A series of small ridges or grooves on a surface for improved grip.
meanings.sent1: The knurling on the handle of the tool helps me hold it securely.
meanings.sent2: The knurling on the doorknob makes it easier to turn.
meanings.sent3: I tried to climb the knurling on the wall, but it was too smooth to grip.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers traced the knurling of the tree bark, feeling each tiny ridge.
meanings.sent5: The knurling on the tire tread provided traction on the wet road.

meanings.definition: The process of creating those ridges or grooves on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The knurling of the metal was done carefully by the craftsman.
meanings.sent2: Knurling involves pressing a pattern onto the material to create grip.
meanings.sent3: The knurling machine hummed as it added texture to the metal rod.
meanings.sent4: The artist's hands moved skillfully to perform the knurling on the sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The knurling process requires precision to achieve the desired pattern.
